turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Arborist.
turn.1: What is the basic principle of arboriculture?
turn.2: Every cut is a wound, and every leaf lost is removal of some photosynthetic potential.
turn.3: Is there anything else interesting about the basic principle of arboriculture?
turn.4: Proper pruning can be helpful in many ways, but should always be done with the minimum amount of live tissue removed.
turn.5: Do you know why they are necessary?
turn.6: In recent years, research has proven that wound dressings such as paint, tar or other coverings are unnecessary and may harm trees.
turn.7: Why do they harm the trees?
turn.8: The coverings may encourage growth of decay-causing fungi.
turn.10: Proper pruning, by cutting through branches at the right location, can do more to limit decay than wound dressing.
turn.11: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.12: Chemicals can be applied to trees for insect or disease control through soil application, stem injections or spraying.
